body:
No luck reproducing this yet.

It's interesting that the test didn't time itself out after 5 minutes. That suggests that the testing package's alarm is stuck in the same limbo as the test's 5ms sleep.

There have been a few recent instances of this test timing out on the dashboard, but they're all 5 minute time-outs from the testing package:
[2015-11-03T19:12:10-b6c0934/dragonfly-amd64](https://build.golang.org/log/0f388f39824d75ea1e6b576a1257a745b0d87104)
[2015-11-24T17:07:45-a150c4f/dragonfly-amd64](https://build.golang.org/log/a2a23151acf69235bd5730878df7958ed0c610bb)
[2015-11-25T17:04:43-3f6b91b/plan9-386](https://build.golang.org/log/aa23eae66ccd224d3912a7d7b91866dcae241be2)
[2015-12-11T16:57:53-62226fa/plan9-386](https://build.golang.org/log/2e27a1c205584c3eab556d0a1ff08838b9c56e1a)
[2015-12-15T20:13:19-01baf13/linux-amd64-nocgo](https://build.golang.org/log/a7048d0c840f1815694b38306ce9e7f723d4e382)

The most recent instances of the build system timing out this test were several months ago:
[2015-08-18T17:41:44-d9dc2f2/netbsd-386-minux](https://build.golang.org/log/66f953822f9c6e902e3f96f858971f6133cb909b)
[2015-08-19T03:28:41-5457563/netbsd-386-minux](https://build.golang.org/log/3fc36bd833ac18b724620d966358eb7fc3f9c368)
[2015-09-08T22:59:09-0ec72b6/linux-arm-arm5](https://build.golang.org/log/7c71c9105b54012f7c576e9f6ee16eeb851f6803)
[2015-09-11T06:02:39-f5c53e0/linux-arm-arm5](https://build.golang.org/log/6852289c825b26b797dc9563ce522f344183f1ea)
[2015-09-11T20:50:46-0726931/linux-arm-arm5](https://build.golang.org/log/7b9a29adcdd1d3a49084757809c6fe556d771cd5)
